name: Thang Duc Bui
content: Thang Bui | ANU School of Computing School Sharepoint College Sharepoint ANU College of Systems & Society Search this site Search this site (powered by Google) Powered by Google Close search Biography Iâm a lecturer in Machine Learning at the School of Computing, Australian National University since July 2022. Before that, I was a lecturer at the University of Sydney from 2018 to 2022 and spent two years (2019-2020) at Uber AI. I completed my doctoral training at the Cambridge Machine Learning group, supervised by Richard Turner and advised by Carl Rasmussen. Interests My current research interests include probabilistic modelling and inference, Monte Carlo and approximate inference methods, distributed, active and continual learning, and model-based reinforcement learning. I am looking for PhD and MPhil students, and a postdoctoral fellow. Please see more here Activities & Awards Please visit my personal homepage at thangbui.github.io/ bars search times
